title: Cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor
data:
**[English]()** • [中文（中国大陆）‎](/wiki/Cheap_plastic_imitation_of_the_Amulet_of_Yendor/zh-CN "Cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor/zh-CN")

| " [![Amulet of Yendor.png](/images/2/2c/Amulet_of_Yendor.png)](/wiki/File:Amulet_of_Yendor.png) |                                                 |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------- |
| Name                                                                                            | cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor |
| Appearance                                                                                      | Amulet of Yendor                                |
| Base price                                                                                      | 0 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                 |
| Weight                                                                                          | [20](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                     |

A **cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor** (**CPIoAoY**), or simply a **fake Amulet of Yendor**, is a type of non-[magical](/wiki/Magical_item "Magical item") [amulet](/wiki/Amulet "Amulet") that exists in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

Per its name, it is a copy of the real [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor") that is made of [plastic](/wiki/Plastic "Plastic") and appears as the "[Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor")" when [unidentified](/wiki/Identification "Identification").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Description](#Description)
- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [3.1 Identification](#Identification)
- [4 History](#History)
- [5 Messages](#Messages)
- [6 Variants](#Variants)
  - [6.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
- [7 References](#References)

## Generation

The "[bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones")" pile found on the [Rogue level](/wiki/Rogue_level "Rogue level") has a 1⁄2 chance of containing an [identified](/wiki/Identification "Identification") cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

Clones of the [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor") created via [Double Trouble](/wiki/Double_Trouble "Double Trouble") while you do not have the real Amulet of Yendor have a 1⁄2 chance of being generated with a fake Amulet.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) [Player monsters](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster") on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane") are all generated with a cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

Wishing for the Amulet of Yendor creates an unidentified cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor[\[4\]](#cite_note-4) - doing so in [wizard mode](/wiki/Wizard_mode "Wizard mode") instead has a 1⁄2 chance of producing a fake Amulet. If the real Amulet is left in a bones file, it will revert to a cursed cheap plastic imitation.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

## Description

The cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor has no effect while worn, outside of the standard 1-[nutrition](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition") loss every 20 turns. Every fake Amulet of Yendor minus the one on the Rogue level will appear as "the Amulet of Yendor" until identified as otherwise.[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)[\[7\]](#cite_note-7) If the [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") attempts to leave the dungeon through the up stair on dungeon level 1 and has only a fake Amulet, they will escape the dungeon and end the game instead of proceeding to the [Elemental Planes](/wiki/Elemental_Planes "Elemental Planes").

Offering a cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor on a [high altar](/wiki/High_altar "High altar") carries a -1 [luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck") penalty *unless* it was identified as a fake:[\[8\]](#cite_note-oops-8) offering a known fake Amulet results in a -3 Luck penalty and a -1 [alignment](/wiki/Alignment_record "Alignment record") penalty, and that god's [anger](/wiki/Anger "Anger") is incremented by 3.[\[9\]](#cite_note-big_oops-9) Offering a fake Amulet on a regular [altar](/wiki/Altar "Altar") will print a message with no other effect.[\[10\]](#cite_note-lil_oops-10)

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Wearing a cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor no longer incurs amulet hunger.

## Strategy

Outside of duping players into thinking they have the real Amulet, the cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor is generally a useless item, though not to the extent of the [iron chain](/wiki/Iron_chain "Iron chain"). The fake Amulet in the Rogue level can potentially be used as [polyfodder](/wiki/Polyfodder "Polyfodder") if you are lacking for viable amulets, though in general you are likely to already have your desired amulet(s) on hand by the time you see a fake of any kind.

### Identification

A fake Amulet of Yendor can easily be confused for the real thing unless identified - many players will immediately [name](/wiki/Name "Name") the Amulet of Yendor "REAL" or something similar immediately upon claiming it from the high priest of Moloch. Another easy way to distinguish between the two is to place your Amulet into a [container](/wiki/Container "Container"), since the real Amulet will resist.

If you are on the [ascension run](/wiki/Ascension_run "Ascension run") and otherwise prepared for your trip to the Planes, you can also use a cursed [potion of gain level](/wiki/Potion_of_gain_level "Potion of gain level") instead of the up stair on DL 1: if you have a fake Amulet and lack the real deal, the potion will have no effect beyond making you "feel uneasy", while doing so with the real Amulet will take you straight to the [Plane of Earth](/wiki/Plane_of_Earth "Plane of Earth").

## History

The cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor first appears in [Hack 1.0.3](/wiki/Hack_1.0.3 "Hack 1.0.3"), where it replaces the real Amulet of Yendor if it is left in a bones file. However, *NetHack* would not introduce the amulet as a class of item until [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

The cheap plastic imitations that [clones](/wiki/Double_Trouble "Double Trouble") of the Wizard of Yendor can generate with is a reference to [NetHack 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.10 "NetHack 3.0.10") and previous versions, including some variants based on them - in these versions, the real Amulet is held by the Wizard himself.

## Messages

- You hear a nearby thunderclap.

  You offered a cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor on an altar, and you are not [deaf](/wiki/Deaf "Deaf") - if the fake Amulet was unidentified and not offered on a high altar, no other message is printed.[\[10\]](#cite_note-lil_oops-10)

- Oh, no.

  This follows the above if you offered an identified cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor on a high altar.[\[9\]](#cite_note-big_oops-9)

- You realize you have made a \<mistake/boo-boo>.

  You offered an unidentified cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor on a high altar[\[11\]](#cite_note-11) - the latter phrasing occurs if you are [hallucinating](/wiki/Hallucinating "Hallucinating").

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [plastic golems](/wiki/Plastic_golem "Plastic golem") drop 2-4 cheap plastic imitations of the Amulet of Yendor upon death in place of a corpse if the `TOURIST` [compile-time option](/wiki/Compile-time_option "Compile-time option") is not defined.[\[12\]](#cite_note-12)

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/extralev.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 361](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/extralev.c#L361)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/wizard.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 504](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/wizard.c#L504)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/mplayer.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 149](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mplayer.c#L149): *The comment above indicates this is why they are "stuck" in the endgame*
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/objnam.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 3828](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/objnam.c#L3828)
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [src/bones.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 179](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/bones.c#L179)
6. [↑](#cite_ref-6) [src/objnam.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 495](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/objnam.c#L495)
7. [↑](#cite_ref-7) [src/objnam.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 836](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/objnam.c#L836)
8. [↑](#cite_ref-oops_8-0) [src/pray.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1574](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/pray.c#L1574)
9. ↑ [9.0](#cite_ref-big_oops_9-0) [9.1](#cite_ref-big_oops_9-1) [src/pray.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1580](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/pray.c#L1580)
10. ↑ [10.0](#cite_ref-lil_oops_10-0) [10.1](#cite_ref-lil_oops_10-1) [src/pray.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1573](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/pray.c#L1573)
11. [↑](#cite_ref-11) [src/pray.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1575](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/pray.c#L1575)
12. [↑](#cite_ref-12) [mon.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 378](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/mon.c#line378 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/mon.c")

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

Cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 中文（中国大陆）‎
"
Name cheap plastic
imitation of the
Amulet of Yendor
Appearance Amulet of Yendor
Base price 0 zm
Weight 20

A cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor (CPIoAoY), or simply a fake Amulet of Yendor, is a type of non-magical amulet that exists in NetHack.

Per its name, it is a copy of the real Amulet of Yendor that is made of plastic and appears as the "Amulet of Yendor" when unidentified.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Description
  • 3 Strategy
    • 3.1 Identification
  • 4 History
  • 5 Messages
  • 6 Variants
    • 6.1 SLASH'EM
  • 7 References

Generation

The "bones" pile found on the Rogue level has a 1⁄2 chance of containing an identified cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor.[1]

Clones of the Wizard of Yendor created via Double Trouble while you do not have the real Amulet of Yendor have a 1⁄2 chance of being generated with a fake Amulet.[2] Player monsters on the Astral Plane are all generated with a cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor.[3]

Wishing for the Amulet of Yendor creates an unidentified cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor[4] - doing so in wizard mode instead has a 1⁄2 chance of producing a fake Amulet. If the real Amulet is left in a bones file, it will revert to a cursed cheap plastic imitation.[5]

Description

The cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor has no effect while worn, outside of the standard 1-nutrition loss every 20 turns. Every fake Amulet of Yendor minus the one on the Rogue level will appear as "the Amulet of Yendor" until identified as otherwise.[6][7] If the hero attempts to leave the dungeon through the up stair on dungeon level 1 and has only a fake Amulet, they will escape the dungeon and end the game instead of proceeding to the Elemental Planes.

Offering a cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor on a high altar carries a -1 luck penalty unless it was identified as a fake:[8] offering a known fake Amulet results in a -3 Luck penalty and a -1 alignment penalty, and that god's anger is incremented by 3.[9] Offering a fake Amulet on a regular altar will print a message with no other effect.[10]

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (NetHack 3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

Wearing a cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor no longer incurs amulet hunger.

Strategy

Outside of duping players into thinking they have the real Amulet, the cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor is generally a useless item, though not to the extent of the iron chain. The fake Amulet in the Rogue level can potentially be used as polyfodder if you are lacking for viable amulets, though in general you are likely to already have your desired amulet(s) on hand by the time you see a fake of any kind.

Identification

A fake Amulet of Yendor can easily be confused for the real thing unless identified - many players will immediately name the Amulet of Yendor "REAL" or something similar immediately upon claiming it from the high priest of Moloch. Another easy way to distinguish between the two is to place your Amulet into a container, since the real Amulet will resist.

If you are on the ascension run and otherwise prepared for your trip to the Planes, you can also use a cursed potion of gain level instead of the up stair on DL 1: if you have a fake Amulet and lack the real deal, the potion will have no effect beyond making you "feel uneasy", while doing so with the real Amulet will take you straight to the Plane of Earth.

History

The cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor first appears in Hack 1.0.3, where it replaces the real Amulet of Yendor if it is left in a bones file. However, NetHack would not introduce the amulet as a class of item until NetHack 3.0.0.

The cheap plastic imitations that clones of the Wizard of Yendor can generate with is a reference to NetHack 3.0.10 and previous versions, including some variants based on them - in these versions, the real Amulet is held by the Wizard himself.

Messages

You hear a nearby thunderclap.
You offered a cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor on an altar, and you are not deaf - if the fake Amulet was unidentified and not offered on a high altar, no other message is printed.[10]
Oh, no.
This follows the above if you offered an identified cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor on a high altar.[9]
You realize you have made a <mistake/boo-boo>.
You offered an unidentified cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor on a high altar[11] - the latter phrasing occurs if you are hallucinating.

Variants

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, plastic golems drop 2-4 cheap plastic imitations of the Amulet of Yendor upon death in place of a corpse if the TOURIST compile-time option is not defined.[12]
